intro: Castanopsis pachycarpa, commonly known as the thick-fruited tanoak, is a species of evergreen tree native to southern China and northern Vietnam. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its dense, glossy evergreen foliage and produces edible, chestnut-like fruits. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing structural support and protection against environmental stressors. Castanopsis pachycarpa plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, supporting a variety of wildlife and contributing to forest biodiversity.
